questions.question: What kind of government does Salem have in The Crucible?
What is Parris’s position in Salem?
Before the play begins, what did Parris catch his daughter and other girls doing?
As the play opens, whom has Parris asked to come to Salem?
Who is the first person Abigail claims practiced witchcraft?
What does Mrs. Putnam blame on witchcraft?

choices.answer: The death of her infant babies

questions.question: What is John Proctor’s chief complaint against Parris’ sermons?

choices.answer: They focus too much on fire and brimstone

questions.question: Where does Elizabeth want John to go, and what does she want him to do there?

choices.answer: She wants him to go apologize to Abigail
She wants him to go help Parris with Betty
To go into Salem and tell others that the girls are lying
To convince Tituba to make the girls tell they are lying

questions.question: What was the evidence against Sarah Good?

choices.answer: She mumbled after begging for cider and bread
She could not recite the commandments in court

questions.question: Why doesn't Proctor want Mary to go back to court?

choices.answer: If she goes back, that makes him further involved.
He believes that the girls are frauds.
It isn't a just court in Proctor's eyes

questions.question: Why did Hale come to Proctor's house?

choices.answer: He wanted to find out why Parris was so bitter
He wanted to question them prior to seeing them in court
To find out if the rumors about John and Abigail were true

questions.question: Hale asks Elizabeth if she believes in witches. What is her reply?

choices.answer: If she's accused of being a witch, she can't believe
If the Bible says witches exist, she cannot dispute it
She does not believe the girls

questions.question: On what charge(s) was Rebecca Nurse arrested?

choices.answer: The murder of Goody Putnam's babies
Inability to recite the 10 commandments from memory

questions.question: What is the deciding factor in Elizabeth's arrest?

choices.answer: Her inability to recite the 10 commandments
Her possession of a doll with a needle in it
The fact that she has not had her son baptized

questions.question: In Act III, why do Giles Corey and Francis Nurse want to see Danforth?

choices.answer: They intend to beat him to his senses.
They want to explain their roles in the witchcraft scheme.
They want to persuade him that their wives are good women.
They want to explain how Parris is at fault.

questions.question: In Act III, what does Mary Warren tell Danforth?

choices.answer: Abigail is not evil; she's just in love with Proctor.
Tituba was responsible for their actions in the woods.

questions.question: Why did Danforth grant Elizabeth extra time?

choices.answer: He didn't blame her for being jealous of Abigail.
She was trying to convince John to confess.

questions.question: Of what does Giles Corey accuse Thomas Putnam?

choices.answer: He accuses him of killing his neighbors for their land.
He accuses him of being in service to the devil.
He accuses him of taking advantage of the girls.
He accuses him of being a hypocrite.

questions.question: When asked why Abigail was released from her service, what did Elizabeth respond?

choices.answer: She thought Abigail and John fancied each other.

questions.question: In Act III, what do the girls do to Mary Warren?

choices.answer: They threaten her, saying she'll regret her accusations.
They pretend that her spirit is coming to get them.
They pretend the devil is in the room.

questions.question: What happens to Proctor?

choices.answer: He is jailed for being a lecher.
He is jailed for lying to the court.
He's jailed for contempt of court and suspicious activities.

questions.question: What did Abigail do in Act IV?

choices.answer: Abigail stole money from Parris and disappeared.
Abigail confessed that she and the others had been lying.

questions.question: In Act IV, why does Hale come back to Salem?

choices.answer: To encourage the accused to confess and save their lives

questions.question: What does Hale want Elizabeth to do in Act IV?
What happened to Giles Corey?

choices.answer: Giles was pressed to death during questioning.
He escaped and went to live in another village.

questions.question: What "confession" did Elizabeth make to John?

choices.answer: She has been involved with witchcraft.
She secretly hoped Abigail would be killed by an angry mob.
She feels she's also responsible for his affair with Abby.

questions.question: What did Proctor do after he signed the confession?

choices.answer: He begged Elizabeth to forgive him.
